body: I saw that the site has passed 25,000 user accounts and that's great. But what is stopping someone from creating several accounts and manipulating votes? I looked through the source code, I don't do web programming in Python, but it looks like it just puts the votes straight into the database with minimal checks. Perhaps you could check IP addresses and add checks for multiple votes coming from single IP addresses. Posts and comments could be being manipulated right now even.
body_html: I saw that the site has passed 25,000 user accounts and that's great. But what is stopping someone from creating several accounts and manipulating votes? I looked through the source code, I don't do web programming in Python, but it looks like it just puts the votes straight into the database with minimal checks. Perhaps you could check IP addresses and add checks for multiple votes coming from single IP addresses. Posts and comments could be being manipulated right now even.
title: Have you guys looked into combatting vote manipulation?

body:
People have been saying this all day because a lot of day old sockpuppet accounts have been showing up. Haven't heard an official response yet though.
From what I've heard in the past Reddit had a few ways of preventing vote manipulation and brigading such as checking IP and having an upper limit on how many downvotes from a single comment could effect you. I had times on Reddit I got like 100 downvotes and only lost about 15 points from my total karma.
body_html: People have been saying this all day because a lot of day old sockpuppet accounts have been showing up. Haven't heard an official response yet though. From what I've heard in the past Reddit had a few ways of preventing vote manipulation and brigading such as checking IP and having an upper limit on how many downvotes from a single comment could effect you. I had times on Reddit I got like 100 downvotes and only lost about 15 points from my total karma.

guild.description:
The official guild for all things Ruqqus.

Rules:

💻 No promotion of other sites that aren't a fork of Ruqqus

🟪 Ruqqus-related only. This is a community dedicated to Ruqqus meta discussion. Content may involve technology and politics but must have ample context in Ruqqus.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

For press releases, visit +RuqqusPress.

For updates and patch notes, visit +changelog.

For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs

post.title: Have you guys looked into combatting vote manipulation?

body: Yeah I was thinking perhaps there could be multiple flags that would add up to put you over a threshold of being considered a vote manipulator account. Like IP, user agent, if an e-mail was provided, how often accounts vote on the same post, etc.
body_html: Yeah I was thinking perhaps there could be multiple flags that would add up to put you over a threshold of being considered a vote manipulator account. Like IP, user agent, if an e-mail was provided, how often accounts vote on the same post, etc.

author.bio:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.
author.bio_html:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body: Honestly if someone cares enough to upvote themselves with alts I think it should just be let go of. Massive amounts of bot votes would still be prohibited because it would fall under spam.
